item.title: An open source Windows package management tool
item.author: wzdushu@gmail.com (wanzi)
item.description: Since I have been using Mac for work and am used to the convenience of installing software packages with brew on Mac, I recently installed Windows on my company computer. I want to try it out. How can I install software packages as smoothly as on MAC? Of course, the protagonist I recommend today is Scoop. Scoop is an open source project that mainly installs Windows software packages through commands.
